conclusion: An ideal gas of definite quality begins at state A, and after undergoing three processes A→B, B→C, and C→A, it returns to its initial state A.
The temperature of the gas at state A is 200K.
The net work done in one clockwise cycle on a p-V diagram equals the area enclosed by the path.
Points are A(2 L, 1×10⁵ Pa), B(2 L, 4×10⁵ Pa), and C(5 L, 1×10⁵ Pa); the path encloses a right-triangle ABC.

premise: Points A and C have volumes 2 L and 5 L respectively.
conclusion: Base (A→C): ΔV = 5 L – 2 L = 3 L = 0.003 m³.

premise: Points A and B have pressures 1×10⁵ Pa and 4×10⁵ Pa respectively.
Base ΔV = 0.003 m³ and height Δp = 3×10⁵ Pa.
conclusion: Area = ½ (ΔV)(Δp) = ½ (0.003 m³)(3×10⁵ Pa) = 450 J.

premise: Area of the triangle ABC is 450 J.
conclusion: Work done by the gas on the surroundings during the entire cycle: W_cycle = +450 J.
